abstract: Facebook is giving its 350 million members new power to control who sees individual items posted on their Facebook pages, but critics say changes to the general privacy settings make more information public by default.
snippet: Facebook is giving its 350 million members new power to control who sees individual items posted on their Facebook pages, but critics say changes to the general privacy settings make more information public by default.
lead_paragraph: Wednesday is privacy day for Facebook’s 350 million members. The company is asking users to review all their privacy settings.

headline.main: Facebook Rolls Out New Privacy Settings
